They also helped us with the best price we could get on the 2 couches and 3 tables and rug we purchased for our living room. Unfortunately the story only gets worse from there. The furniture arrived promptly when expected, however one of the couches was marked and messed up in multiple areas. It appeared it was either used or just poorly overlooked. The coffee table also had a board reversed on it showing the nail holes on just one board when it shouldn’t have been. There was also a gap in parts of the wood that we were told on the phone shouldn’t be there. After calling customer service and discussing it with them, they arranged for the defective pieces to be replaced. When the new couch arrived, it was in much better condition, and the table had all the boards the right direction this time. Unfortunately it still had the gap in the wood. We also noticed after comparing the new couch to the original couch that wasn’t replaced that the arms were a different shape. The new arms were straight, and the original couches arms slanted. The stitching on the original couch also had uneven stitching. I know that it can come across as not picking, however when you spend over 5k on something you tend to expect a certain level of quality and quality control. This entered us into about a week long game of phone tag with customer service in which ultimately they didn’t want to swap anything out any more, but also were initially going to charge us a 20% restocking fee. After discussing further with customer service they finally said that they couldn’t really process the return and refund, and we would have to go to the store. Luckily, Jesse, the manager on duty, was fantastic. When we came into the store I’m sure he could feel the frustration oozing off of us after the customer service run around. He helped us through the process and arranged for everything to get picked up and refunded. We were out the delivery fee, but that is far and beyond better than 20%. All said and done, is the main reason I’m going with 3 stars. 5 stars for the local store and the staff. 1 star for the phone customer service and the quality control on this new line of furniture.

title: My Thoughts Related to Home Zone Furniture
text: I've read a lot of the poor ratings on this company and, unfortunately, I only read them the next day AFTER I had already made a purchase at the Waco store. Being new to Waco and not having access to the Internet since I was only in town for that one day to look at a place for my mother to live, I am responding based on my limited experience at this time with the Waco store. Since I am new to Waco and am not familiar with places to shop for furniture, I just happened to drive by the store. I turned around and my mother and I went in to look at what they offer in products, their product-quality, and prices.First, I can only comment on the sales staff at this time. Both of us were impressed with the sales staff in the Waco store. My mother needed to purchase a bedroom suite and a bed. Anna B. was very knowledgeable about the furniture and thoroughly answered her questions. What I cannot comment presently regarding the Waco store is (1) the condition of the furniture when it is delivered and (2) whether it will be delivered when my mother needs it. I am concerned about the many, many negative comments about the customer service related to the Austin store. Fortunately, I did meet the Waco store manager and left with the impression that he is interested in satisfying the customer as well as meeting the company's sales objectives. What is to be seen is what will actually be his priority; will it be his customers' satisfaction or will it be the money?I am rather concerned that this company has not figured out how to combine both of them together. Alternatively, they have personnel issue(s) in Austin that need(s) to be resolved and they may not be acknowledging and/or addressing those problem(s).Hopefully, with the Waco store being under a different manager, it will not have the customer dissatisfaction that Austin has.My other concern relates to the fact that a store located in an area as large as Waco and its surrounding communities does not offer free delivery, but charges its customers a $99 delivery fee and THEN ONLY DELIVERS on three days during the week. If customers are paying for delivery, then shouldn't a customer's REASONABLE delivery request  be the first priority? There is possibly something off with the Home Zone Furniture focus  because they have given many people the impression that they are putting their needs (i.e., profits) BEFORE the needs, desires and/or expectations of their customers.  I think they have it backwards because if companies meet the needs, desires and/or expectations of their customers, then profit ALWAYS follows as long as other costs are managed and controlled, such as product quality, product selection and appropriate product pricing.Since I am moving my mother to Waco from another part of Texas, it is not convenient for us to drive three hours in order to be available and present when Home Zone Furniture decides they can deliver her furniture. If they do not deliver on the scheduled day or if the furniture is damaged and we do not accept it, I am stuck with paying for a hotel room or spending hours on the road driving back home only to turn around and do it all over again...at Home Zone Furniture's convenience. Timing is a critical issue for us and everything needs to work smoothly like the cogs of the wheels in a clock. I have major concerns about this, unfortunately, and I am waiting to see how well the Waco store will address any customer service issues we may possibly experience. Overall, I can only hope that I have not made a mistake purchasing from Home Zone Furniture and also that my mother and I will be pleased when her new furniture is delivered. We are both looking forward to her settling into her new home and are counting on Home Zone Furniture to help make that a reality for her.

text: I went in HomeZone on Saturday needing a couch desperately. We had went in the day before and looked around and got an idea of what we wanted. We were greeted by Marie, at first I wasn't going to get any help since the day before the sales rep wasn't very knowledgeable but she insisted so I followed her. She showed me the Big Easy couch. We needed a couch now because we had none and sitting on the floor is not much of an option for me seeing as I have arthritis in my back and have spasms and sciatic nerve issues so I asked her if they would sell us the floor model. She asked her manager and he said no. I was very disappointed and just really didn't want to be there anymore. I saw another couch but I was just really sold on the Big Easy. I went home disappointed, sat on my floor and called another store out of town. I was willing to travel an hour and a half to get the couch I wanted but they were out to. They actually sold their floor model. I went on your website and looked into other options and found another I was interested in (not as much as the other but sitting on the floor for 3 weeks wasn't an option). We went back in and decided to settle for the other one but was also disappointed to find out that I would still have to wait about a week for that one to come in to! We needed a couch and at that point I was just ready to get one, the sooner I ordered the sooner I'd get it. I'm just not happy with the in stock availability. The sales rep Marie was absolutely amazing and very knowledgeable but the experience was not so great. So here I am, sitting on the floor, writing this review and hoping my couch will be in sooner than later. I really wish the manager would have sold me the floor model because I really don't enjoy my back pain. I wish I would've been able to get the couch I wanted instead of settling for another. But I guess one customer is not worth breaking the "rules" to make happy.
